_GeaBuAfOXHDkT9ueawVkA.text: I am at Stoke's probably once a week for either dinner or beer...well, always beer! Awesome bar and grill and they have a great rotating draft list with a lot of local brews which is nice. Everything I've eaten here has been good...sandwiches, pizzas, soups. Always have a seat at or near the bar. And, the service is always wonderful! For the type of place it is and the expectations one might have for a casual bar and grill, Stoke's is 5 stars.

Wts3dyCsUOa6MW7nOh0GZw.text: Just wanted to give a heads up that this is NOT a BYOB restaurant anymore, but they do sell liqueur and beers and such.

xmyEEsz--UgojGZFE6YxqA.text: I'd looked online and Yelp for good ideas for places to eat in the North Hills besides chain restaurants, and Stoke's seemed like a good choice.  We came in around 4 and there were a handful of people both at the bar and in the main dining area.  An attentive, and helpful waitress seated us immediately.  I was starving and we were both excited to try from the craft beer selection.  We were offered samples of a lager before we bought it, which was a nice touch!  We ordered the white fries (aiolli and garlic onion strings topped) which really hit the spot.  The fries were crisp and hot.  He ordered a burger and onion rings, but fries were brought instead.  They were apologetic, and brought the rings quickly and we kept the fries.  I had the larkshead roast beef pretzel.  The beef was just a tiny bit dry, but the tasted very good.  I didn't mind that it wasn't a pretzel bun, but instead a real pretzel.  I actually like a little "pick apart" food.  The salad was mixed greens, fresh and not wilted.  The waitress came back multiple times to check on us.  The prices are typical of the American pub places.  The food is a cross between some convenience with a flair of creative ideas and better quality food items.  Kinda enjoyed the Beatles, 60s and 70s music vibe that day.  Overall, we would return if in the area to try more brews and some of the soups.  No complaints here.

nEdDCn16-CXJSeFlXIKMsw.text: Ever since I posted this review the restaurant owner  has been harassing me by private email!!!  Accusing me of having OCD simply because we didn't like his food and we complained about it!!  This man is despicable!!! His food and his restaurant should be avoided at all cost!  If anyone knows how to contact Yelp so I can forward his private emails to me I would appreciate it, thanks!!!

bBeiAv32St_Gla1LGzytkw.text: The food is great, but the beer is ludicrously expensive, my fault i suppose for not looking at the price before ordering, but for $9 was like half a pint, like it was served in one of those stella artois looking glasses but smaller. The kicker was the waitress who didnt bring us water for almost the entirety of the meal. It was dead on a saturday night, she had 2 other tables and couldnt remember WATER. She came back three times after we had to ask twice for the water and we are sitting there cringing as we ate our sodium packed meal without water. Im not saying it was overly salty or anything, but for what we were eating we didnt want our water right before the fucking check; the russian dressing, au ju dip, the pesto on the french fries. I had to force it all down because i had no water, put it in a cup and bring it to me, dont come back with more of my salty food and NOT the fucking water i should have had before my app got here. She would disappear for 15 mins at a time and then come back without water. To top it all off she stole $5 out of our change. She didnt bring back the check with our change and after we waited like suckers for 10 minutes for her to come back we got the hint she was hiding from us in the kitchen we gave up and left.

QbwS5_SoKJNrdeOrlkws1g.text: Pros: Very clean, good service. Cons: A little pricey for what you get. I got a sandwich and onion rings and it cost me $15. I didn't know until afterwards that I could've subbed the rings for chips. Wish the guy would've told me that. Anyway, the rings were fresh and very good.  The sandwich? Not so much.  Maybe it's what I got, but I'll pass on this one next time.

Qp2q47c5VZKvr5-MdYqbCA.text: I had a very nice (and fast) lunch at this place. I tried the BLT, fried pretzel and took the tomato pepperjack soup and mac and cheese to go. The BLT was "classic" style, quality toasted white bread and lots of crispy bacon. So much in fact I managed to knock over my water glass while trying to stuff it all back in the sandwich. The fried pretzel was very meh, I wouldn't get it again.  The soup and mac and cheese was excellent and reheated well for dinner at home. Lots of homemade mac and cheese is oily/greasy but the consistency of the Stoke's version was perfect, super creamy and the cheese hugged the noodles. Soup had a great flavor, very peppery.   Pricing was a buck or two more you might pay at your average  diner but you can tell they use quality/homemade components which is why it is a little bit more. Overall I enjoyed my lunch here. The order at the counter style is nice if you are alone or want to get something quick for takeout.

Ir5jWldPouMh3A6itYWpEg.text: We were there late after bowling with a party of 13. We called the day before to reserve a table. They had some customers but not crowded. The waitress was friendly and did a nice job. The kitchen was VERY slow. The food came 30-45 minutes after we ordered. Not sure why it took so long. The beer selection was nice. Several unique brews. The food was good once it finally came. I would consider trying them again but others in our group won't. Too bad because we always go out after bowling and it's a big sale for the restaurant.

NrGE8BgFm8NSQAOf3lQbiA.text: Food wasn't too good.  Greasy, deep fried Montecristo sandwich.  Cole slaw was lacking mayonnaise.   Mushroom soup was decent.  Squash soup was bland.   Took home ribs.   They were breaded.  Who does that?   Very disappointed.   Had very good meals there before.   They need to fix things.   Or we won't be back.

5YcJpckCh6IrDhDYiqQr1A.text: Food was great!  We had the Philly Chicken and Chicken Salad.   The service was REALLY poor; the were short staffed by 3 WAITRESSES and 2 cooks!!!!   They actually turned 3 groups of people away because they had no staff and flipped the CLOSED SIGN on!  We waited 30 minutes for food and did without refills!  Again, food was great but service was horrible.

CW8WStYk0LggPG0aPGthAw.text: I've been here 3 times in the past week and if it wasn't for the food, I wouldn't be returning. In all seriousness, it is evident that they are understaffed, which is reflected in the service and long wait time of food. This is disappointing because their food is really, really good, but if things don't improve soon I'm moving on to somewhere new.

UD8V8RHuDfiJuTmqYfnlWQ.text: We have dined in and taken out of Stoke's Grill on several occasions.  Their pizza is really really good, and is a good item for take out.  Their soups, in particular, their butternut squash soup, is also very good.  The spices in the squash soup - the warm nutmeg - and the creaminess of it, make it so good.  Perfect in the wintertime!  When we dined in, we got the white fries with the white garlic aioli - very very good.  I really liked the aioli.  While neither my husband or I drink beer, they look like they have a good selection of bottled and draft beers.  I'm particularly impressed with the place despite it being in a strip mall.

YYSd0Ancts-D_QoPM2jYfw.text: Great food, great service.  I like nearly every thing I've eaten here.  Their chili queso appetizer is the best I've had in Pittsburgh and they have a great variety of unique items.

2eI-iIklYhMAFciBa2P4qw.text: I've eaten at Stoke's many times. I love the pizza and the burgers, in fact it's hard to find anything I haven't really liked. The rotating tap menu always has a great selection of craft beers. It's a great relaxing environment for lone diners and families too. Between the menu and the setting I can't wait for my next visit to Stoke's. When they're busy it's great to see how the staff really steps up the pace to give everyone the best experience possible. The owners of this restaurant do a fantastic job serving quality food and drink in a fun and vibrant atmosphere. I highly recommend this eatery.

YH0CSBcZ54DjMLt_kdjk6g.text: We were there on a Saturday afternoon.. It wasn't very crowded. The food was delicious. There was so many different homemade soup options (I had the southwest creamy chicken & it was soo good). My guy had the funky chicken pizza which was verry yummy as well... We also has the cheese queso w/pretzel pieces for an app... There is also ToNs of beer selections...Def worth a visit if you're out in the area!

S5V2B5dP-Io2KrA2GFhSpQ.text: The chili wasn't too bad it's a lot like spaghetti sauce. The buffalo chicken mac n cheese was ok. It had a loose cheese sauce, not a hard crispy oven baked dish for which I had hoped.  The buffalo chicken did have a good flavor so I'll probably get it next time I'm in the area. I wouldn't go out of my way to get the mac n cheese or the chili. It took the hostess a long time to figure out that a quart of chili is $11?  And that's printed on the menu. I had to ask for plastic ware after she handed me my to go order?

ZH-avYE1qlh3Q2fqyBvzmw.text: Yum! Yum! Yum homemade soup!  Second visit and have tried the homemade soup both times.  Nothing like a good bowl of soup on some of these overcast cold days to warm the body and put a sparkle in the mind!    Had the tomato pepper jack soup.  So tasty creamy rich tomato with the sharp pepper jack.  Had the Reuben Gone Fishin'..fresh talapia with coleslaw, swiss and russian dressing...very good and a little sloppy.  Great combination.     Meet some friends and everyone tried one of the soups.  I think they had 4 available.  Everyone was pleased!   Also, BYOB and we did! Nice place to eat and visit with friends over a warm soup and glass of wine.

wHiZ2TARz4OdEy8cRRrDLQ.text: Found Stoke's from reviews right here on Yelp. Based on my first visit I can concur that the food at this place is fantastic. It doesn't look like much from the outside, or even from the furnishings inside, but it's the food that counts. I had the Ropa Vieja (pressed sandwich with carnitas pork, red peppers and grilled onions with a side of au jus) and one of the soups of the day, tomato pepper jack. If I had one criticism it would be that the soup was maybe a little too hot, but otherwise, everything was perfect. I have a new favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh, and I plan to return.

W_vCYg_3a4BnD5w1GobH2Q.text: We've been making Stoke's a frequent stop - their soup is great and the sandwiches are creative without being too crazy. They use quality ingredients and it's nice to eat somewhere that has real chicken tenders for my son! I recommend the pretzel sandwiches and their homemade chips hit the spot!

TT-Zq2tQzPAEKZFGozxBcQ.text: Although a bit overpriced the food is very good. However the service is wretched. It's really a shame. This could be a very decent restaurant however customer service is not a concern of management.

mUea4e-Qfpe_1fXlX5FdDg.text: We've been there 2 times, both times the food is fantastic.  The white cheddar fry app, $6 burgers on Wed and everything else has been yummy.   You have to go with time to spare.  They are clearly short staffed and the time to get drinks and food is Loooooooong  Once that improves its a 5 star in my book.

PddIb3gq88y5hkDMorui7Q.text: I've passed this place many, many times and but never gave it a second look because of it's location. (It's in a strip and I admit that I just assumed it was like every other sports bar because of that.) But a friend was told their food is great, so we went.  Even though it's location is sort of obvious, I'd call it a hidden gem. It's NOT like your average sports bar - there's a seated restaurant on the other side of the bar and you cannot hear the bar at all.   Awesome service, delicious food, amazing mixed drinks, great atmosphere. I wish I would have visited sooner!

96TTrIJx8BKlbyLpBnXPEg.text: I have eaten at a lot of the food establishments on McKnight Road but I still keep finding places to try. Stokes Grill was a great pick. It is a bar and restaurant  which are separate. They have a great selection if beers and you can choose some to take home.  Their menu had some nice offerings.  I chose the Shrimp Tacos. The tacos had two small flour shells. Two were needed because they were stuffed full!  There were a very nice portion of crispy fried shrimp. Along with the shrimp was a crispy tasty slaw. I don't know what all was in the sale but it complimented the shrimp perfectly. There was lime juice and a salsa too. The tacos came with hand made chips which were light and crispy. I also ordered a cup of their Mac & Cheese. It was made with a white cheese that is melted and poured over small pasta shells. It is creamy and smooth and a bit rich. I can't imagine eating a bowl of it as a meal, but it is offered as such.  I will definitely go back and try more items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Homemade potato chips.
Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Tacos and Mac n Cheese

oNi3CZLFUx6P2WRW7to94w.text: Um maybe the beer is good, the servers are very nice . However the food was lacking I ordered an appetizer and stopped there. The buffalo chicken dip taste like queso with chicken chunks in it and was cold. The pita taste like it has it had hand sanitizer on it , my first time here and I won't be back

avnzQLQa-t7uDftukeKRhQ.text: The upgraded drafts were a great addition. Soups are good, couple sandwiches I've had were also good, fries.. not so good, kind of boring. My last visit I had Cuban and my wife had Reuben. Reuben was good just portions are terrible. I took my Cuban apart to look inside... how embarrassing for you Stokes. This sandwich was pitiful and pathetic! There was 2 pieces of ham and the pork didn't even cover all the small bread. Told bartender and she took it in the back and came right back out and said sorry they weigh it and that's how it is, 4 ounces she said. Trust me the whole sandwich didn't weigh 4 ounces. I recognized the male owner and he didn't have decency to come and say two words to me about it. I understand weighing things but if you can't make a sandwich look good for $10 maybe you should up the weight. Onion rings were a joke too, 5 of the smallest, thinnest onions you could get for $1 more. Too many other places with better value. WE WILL NOT BE BACK STOKES!

_WyQfN3HKtjUq2hpMgapUQ.text: Wow! Hate to do this to you. However, I got a Steak Wit to go and there's absolutely no meat on it. What a HUGE waste of $!

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rip off!

_RdqljS1Nbazuxua7HRaJg.text: In a sea of chain restaurants on McNight, Stokes is a good pick. They always have 5-6 soups from scratch, and a ton of great sandwich options. I love the veggie pesto sandwich which is on pressed hoagie bread. The mac n cheese is great, especially on these cold winter days. Lots of beers on tap too. Check it out.

x5M2lVqnZViEmd82wLDzWw.text: We went there for the first time on 12/22 and won't be returning:  As we arrived:  - The place was empty, minus a 7 person party in another room. Took minutes to get a waitress.  - Waitress does our app orders, then doesn't even bother to ask if we were ready to order. She went away for 5 minutes before returning.  The apps:  - I got chili cheese fries and a pretzel with queso. The fries were supposed to be large size but were only enough for one person. They used store chili that tasted like it came from the can. No flavor, originality or quality to it. The pretzels were more like one pretzel and came HAND RIPPED apart. Yes, they ripped it with their hands. Gross  The meal:  - I got a burger on a pretzel bun with chips. The pretzel bun wasn't a bun, it was a pretzel cut in half. What? Immediately went over to a waitress and asked for a bun. I waited and waited, nothing came. Our waitress then came over and apologized and she didn't even bring a bun. I also asked for chips and she gave me fries. We ended up telling them to take the burger back because we didn't want to pay for it and it took so long that I wasn't even hungry.  - My mom got a hoagie. If the burger thing sounded bad, this was right up there. The hoagie came on two three inch dinner rolls. There was barely any lettuce and one tomato. It was basically a sandwich, not a hoagie. The presentation and ingredients were awful. My mom was going to give it back but she was hungry and we had wasted enough time on the whole fiasco.  - The waitress apologized for the bad experience. Did she get a manager? No. Did they give us a discount to entice us to try again? No. They did nothing. They didn't care.  Overall:  - This place was awful and may have been one of the worst meals we've ever had. I have no idea why anyone would go to this place when the North Park Longue is right up the street and gives you more food with better quality for the same price. This place is awful and we will never go back.

f7PdgS45Ckalfymai4VM-g.text: Unusual place. Food is okay but overpriced for what you get. Sort of awkward to eat in. Will try again but have eaten here twice and been unimpressed.

RjWhjleoT1E9dxpaDRTj6g.text: Great little place tucked non-descriptly in a strip mall on McKnight road. Awesome beer selection, great food. Reasonably priced. My personal favorites are the "White" fries and pretty much all of their soups.

brK_IeXqpU3yjmtASQruEw.text: My fiance and I love this place! Their menu has so many great options to choose from. We recommend it whenever we can, very underrated!

2GuPwDDc30TBDAdy-w-jsw.text: I've been coming to stokes for about 8 years or so now, and they have come a long way from the new family-owned soup and sandwich restaurant they were on McKnight. Just in the past few years, they've expanded their dining room and added on a bar room serving a wide selection of craft beer. To their menu, they've also added pizza, which from the few I have tried were amazing. Overall, the food is excellent, the service and the owners are even better, and this is a must stop if you're looking for a quick lunch or a place to go for happy hour for a good craft beer.

32KfimSvi5P1BC5pEvZYRQ.text: Love everything about this place except for the mellow Dad-rock music that's always playing. Excellent and varied beer selection, extremely knowledgeable bar and wait staff, great and inventive food. We usually just eat and leave, though. With the super boring music, there is no incentive to head to the bar area afterwards to enjoy a few more drinks. We're usually half asleep by the time we're done eating. We're not looking for a club scene, but a little bit more upbeat music would punch the vibe up just enough to make people linger a bit longer. After all, that's what they want, right?

to_4SmAWV39cQB5fvVXaig.text: I don't understand why I clarified who is on my bill and I put my credit card on the bar 15 minutes ago why I am still sitting here.  The Sonoran hot dogs were good.

r13zqNt4w5Qm6BIB05bflg.text: In an area full of restaurant chains, it's always great when a family owned and operated establishment becomes 'king of the road'. Stoke's serves some of the best sandwiches and most delicious pizza's McKnight Road has to offer. Forget about going to any of those chains for over priced meals when you can get home made entrees right at Stoke's Grill.

c1ms62g1Jvtd3KnACOJTlQ.text: Thanks to a gross, rainy night I was craving some soup. After living in the North Hills for about 8 months I've driven past stokes probably 100 times. Being in the mood for soup I knew that it was finally time to stop driving by and finally venture in. Stokes Grill is located in a strip mall on Mcknight Road and the interior of the space reflects this. It's large, wide open, and lacking in personality. One thing I did appreciate though was that the interior walls are decorated with art from local artists, all of which is for sale.   For what the space lacks in personality it makes up for in great food. I ordered the Buf Chix wrap, a buffalo chicken wrap full of your standard fixins and blue cheese dressing. To accompany my wrap, and  to fulfill my soup craving, I order a bowl of their broccoli cheddar soup. The soup was delivered quickly, piping hot, and in a large portion. I'd say Stoke's broccoli cheddar soup rivals all others out there and certainly defeats Pannera's, my long time favorite.   The reason I give Stoke's 4 stars rather than 5 is the price. A wrap, a bowl of soup, and a fountain drink ran me $15. Yes, the bowl of soup was large and the wrap came with chips, but I feel like this was priced about $3-5 too high. I'll definitely be back to try some of their other soups and sandwiches, but its probably only going to be on days where I'm flushed with cash!  Also its BYOB

gWEIeVMxLftScKnR2tYiDg.text: Service can be slow, but the staff is very nice and the food is delicious! I have been going there since it first opened, and the owners know/recognize me by name,and remember certain things about me and ask about them. The mac and cheese is absolutely phenomenal. The drink menu is also very good. I personally love the purple people eater. Expansive beer list and big (but not overly so) menu selection that caters to a lot of my personal wants.

XhHGhxWrfgJ04RUHHk8gUg.text: Great 'bar food' menu with some sandwich pairings you wouldn't normally see. Also a great beer selection for the craft/micro brew lover. A great place to stop in for a quick bite in the North Hills!

ABwvaI2zSQFwW_9nvlHwUw.text: Wanted to give this place a try with my wife on Friday night. We were seated by hostess and sat for 15 minutes without sight of a server. Asked another passing server if they knew where our server might be. She said that she was in the back of the restaurant and would ask her to come by. Another 10 minutes passed. Nothing. Left and went to monte cellos where we got prompt friendly service. Sorry Stokes. We tried to give you our money. Won't happen again.

nRhNn2RAmSMhvXRzJpBSLA.text: Very poor experience. Waited an hour for food that never came. They never put in our appetizer. People around us who came in after us got served and left. The water tastes like it came out of a bucket. Never even got to try the food. I won't be returning anytime soon. The owner never even apologized. I wouldn't even eat there for free.

tmb8MZgJ1kpnuMKsULVr8w.text: I was really surprised by this place. It is unassuming, tucked into a plaza at the Pittsburgh end of Mcknight. My BF actually didn't want to go and gave me a hard time about it because he thought there was no way the food would be good. I wish I would have read more reviews before going though, because I didn't know they made their own soup and didn't get any :(  I got a veggie sandwich and the BF got pizza (he picked his own toppings) both were surprisingly good. The decor and heating in the restaurant leave something to be desired... We were pretty cold inside, and the booths/tables were a little aged. The drinks/beer menu were also surprisingly diverse and tasty. We got a ginger beer concoction and a craft brew that were both tasty.  I'm glad to have discovered this place.

FVYL0Q80X-meGCBPeo9Fbw.text: Good Beer selection, food not so good, Cuban sandwich burnt and could not find any meat! Onion Rings were soggy. They schoud take Cuban sandwich off the menu, the waitress talked me into it as her favorite??

LXBRSa3fMF31MFCOg5gFyQ.text: I have only tried one thing here the two times I came while in town. I liked it so much that's all I have ordered. Haha! I absolutely love Reuben sandwiches and theirs is really good. I'm from Houston and you can't hardly find anyone who serves those here. The fries are good. The service was good and the place was clean and cozy. I will be back next time i am in town.

qtQgsDMNk68XfLkI2Ueolg.text: We've been to Stokes many times over the past few years.  Their food is excellent - we've never had a bad meal there.  But they really need to hire a few more waitstaff!  Every time we go, there are 2 waitstaff for the whole restaurant.  They walk by the tables, zoned in on what table they're visiting, and never look to see if other tables might need something.  I really want this restaurant to thrive - they're local owned - but they are never crowded - and I would bet that it's due to the lack of staff.  We were there at 7 pm on a Saturday night and less than half the tables had people.  Also, on this particular visit, they were out of many beers.  My husband asked for 3 different beers and they were all out - and the people at the table next to us had the same issues.  That's not right for a restaurant with an adjoining bar that claims to have a ton of beers.

RdLIuPJfO-4X5kdnEMeUrA.text: I love their crab bisque usually. Sometimes the cook has a heavy hand with the old bay. Lol.  I also love the sandwich with turkey and sauerkraut {turkey Ruben is it called?} Some of the best sauerkraut I've ever had!  My mom & I only come every so often because the service is AWFUL. Disappointing because the food is yummy!

W20GFBCh7S81rKW303I4eg.text: Tomato Pepperjack soup.  Go get it.  Now.  Creamy and delicious tomato soup with a zing?  What more could you want in life?  The service was really friendly when I went in with my friend, and they were chatting it up with us while we waited for our to go orders.    The only downside was that they were out of both or their mac and cheeses by 6:00 or so on a weeknight.  Clearly, it's a hit.  But total bummer.  I'm still trying to get back to try it out.  The actual space is pretty drab, but the BYOB feature is totally redeeming.  The food is on the pricier side for the size and quality, but it is a local establishment.  Hoping to make it back soon to try more!

fFfRXuLSi3ji-ujtxj8rtA.text: I've stopped in to Stoke's Grill a few times over the last two months, and I've been very pleased each time.  As dozens of others commented, its beer selection is high-quality, and they make it apparent to carry as many local craft beers as possible.    As for the food... I can say w/o reservation that their burgers, quesadillas and pizzas are super tasty. My favorite is the DunCow.  On McKnight, it's chain after chain restaraunt, so it's also nice to support a family owned and operated business.

iKOR14E6iROIm-ypVJoN1w.text: Good selection of beers but the service was just okay and the food was quite underwhelming. Not terrible but certainly not good enough that I'll return or recommend it at all.

H2XpY8sXpZpW6gY3HtwRdg.text: A solid lunch here today with the best service I've ever experienced here. I warned my family that our actual lunch would be good but service would be pretty sketchy from my previous experiences here. That was, thankfully, not the case today. And this is actually the first time I've been here- and I've visited maybe 6-8 times over the past few years-that I have not had absolutely dismal service. We were sat quickly when we arrived around 12:30. I should note there were only two other tables at this time. Our server was quite young, first time I've seen her here, but she was very nice and checked back on us frequently. The beer selection, while not as top notch as I have become accustomed to since moving to DC, is quite extensive for the Burgh with many craft options. I had a beer- bells two hearted which at $6 is quite reasonably priced. Yuengling was on special- and is all day Saturday- for $2. Soup options were plentiful- chili, crab bisque, tomato pepper jack, cream of mushroom, wedding, and split pea. Sandwich special was a turkey, Apple, cheddar, and bacon, which sounded pleasant but I went with my tried and True favorite- turkey Reuben on French. I did the 1/2 sandwich with soup and chose wedding. The wedding was pipping hot (perfect for the dreary Pittsburgh day) and very flavorful. It was chock full of both chicken and meat balls with celery and carrots. The traditional spinach and pearl pasta was missing, nonetheless I thoroughly enjoyed my soup. I wish there had been a tad more 1000 island on the sandwich but I won't make bones about it. My mom had the pulled pork and said it was quite tasty with a smoky yet sweet BBQ sauce. My dad had the frizzle quesadilla, consisting of chicken, bacon, cheddar,and ranch. It was a very large portion and came with a side (he chose broccoli salad) too. My boyfriend had the chicken Parmesan hoagie with fries. He enjoyed the hoagie, which was again, quite large in portion size. The fries, which I can vouch for since I snagged a few, were hot and crispy with a nice seasoned salt/pepper mix on top. I highly recommend visiting Stokes if you're in the area. It's always nice to support a local business, particularly in the sea of chain restaurants that is McKnight Road.

KB3_mE_rNtoqcALgxrxpMA.text: Awesome food! Homemade crab bisque and great sandwiches! Nice selection of beer and its surprisingly easy to get a table.

lTgupMoTdDYQEx8LYtcw6g.text: This could be the worst restaurant I have been to in a long time. Service was beyond bad. It has been years since I left no tip ( I am usually a 30% tipper).  The food was horrible and the portions were small and left us wanting to go somewhere else for dinner now that we had appetizers. We asked to see the manager who never came out. Save yourself the trouble and go els

w8ksRWYuOR8WYTzh-LMOag.text: The rumors are True! Best soup ever! I had the deliciously creamy Tomato Pepperjack! I only had the cup, but thought maybe it should have been a bowl. Or a tub of it! So flavorful!  I also ordered the Hitch Pretzel Sandwich. This was no ordinary pretzel sammie though. It was a legit pretzel. Toasted. With Turkey, lettuce, tomato and honey mustard. Is it a brilliant idea? Yes. But was it easy to eat? No.   I ended up pulling it apart and eating it in sections. The best was the toasted pretzel itself with honey mustard slathered on top. I could have done with a bowl of the tomato pepperjack and the toasted pretzel (WITH HONEY MUSTARD) alone and been a happy camper.   Now I know it's going to be hard to come out here for my frequent Target trips and not make a pit stop for some soup!

CVBDQTcKRfRsNig8wcAbMA.text: Came in during Pittsburgh Craft Beer Week. I was surprised that it wasn't busier.   Positives : Great beer selection  Creative menu  Negatives: Small portions Negative attitude of the staff  Small bar area   During the hour and a half I was there, one of the waitresses had 3 separate meltdowns... All related to the fact that she rang in a drink wrong and mistake caused drafts instead of flights to be poured.   Further, I was deciding between 2 different drafts and chose a beer due to the menu saying that it was on special. When I got my check, it was showing full price. I showed it to the bartender (who, in her defense, was the nicest person we saw last night) and she got her manager. The manager acted like I was the one who made the mistake and acted annoyed that I brought it up to her. She, instead of giving me the sale price on the 3 beers I drank since her beer list stated it incorrectly, gave me an discount of $3.50.  I still was overcharged but didn't have the energy to fight it.   It's a shame that they don't want to bring in more customers because it has potential..

snw4nRRQuUAmTJWmAWU94Q.text: Fabulous soups!  I ordered 2 gallons of their mushroom soup for my Christmas Eve celebration and my family LOVED it!   Stop in for a pick-two (soup + 1/2 sandwich) and I'm sure you won't be disappointed.   And the people running the place are lovely.  So nice to have a small business with quality service and excellent food.

OfoRqfWPhiAybgwMFan4XA.text: When we decided to buy a house, my husband's main concern was where his new go-to bar was going to be. He insisted we were now too far from any good ones. He was pleasantly surprised when I insisted that we try Stoke's.   Don't be discouraged by the the bars location in a strip mall (I know we initially were). The bar is a nice size with high tops along the window. The restaurant section is a little sterile so we prefer to sit in the bar.   The main selling point is the beer selection! They have multiple coolers filled with beers to choose from and the bartender is more than knowledgable to make suggestions if they are out of a fave.   So far everything we've tried food wise has been delicious. My mom is obsessed with their chicken philly and my husband liked "the dank". I've heard good things about their soup but it's been to hot outside for me to try any.   We will definitely make this a go to place!

et1mpqy8-gMFhGAe3xoFAQ.text: Been here numerous times and always delicious! Being from NY I think their pizza is one of the best in Pittsburgh. Also if you are a craft beer lover this place is it!!! So many great beers for everyone! Hidden gem!!!

_2_nEzQOKqOfMs-tHiR4Hg.text: Great food and beer selection!  4 stars because service has improved, but still not great.  Don't go if you're on a time crunch.

XxjH3H_6DzQ0islm1DEciw.text: This place is just OK. The food is average and they have a lot of beers to choose from. The price is a little higher than I would like for the quality of food and service.

vGwBtYL7TCHSk_f6EQmlIA.text: Came here with my parents, who were in from out of town. Restaurant was half full, took a good 15 minutes to get drinks, another hour for our food. Our order was not correct, we were given no utensils and no condiments. Poor management planning for staff on a Saturday night.. do not recommend for a good meal.

hWbtteych2Elzlufk30iWQ.text: Good brew selection and the burgers were only $6 on Wednesday night. The Animal Style burger was delicious and the service was great. Perfect place to watch a game.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huge selection of great beer

G2mCSm-c4hBeRY4mgjFRRw.text: I used to LOVE this place but the food has went from outstanding to just ok.  Today I ordered a MotMot and crab bisque.  The soup was thick and tasteless and the MotMot, which has always been my favorite, lacked flavor and was soggy.  I'm disappointed and not sure I will return.

wxmlOZdKTXOzDTvt_fS97g.text: I really WANT to like this place, but every trip it gets harder! I've given it two chances, and needless to say I won't be back. It's a shame, the food is very good but it takes a LIFETIME to get it! The last straw was today when my sister and I stopped for lunch. We waited over 40 mins for our sandwiches and my sisters was wrong! When we sent it back, we received the corrected one  10 minutes later, with our apology, but according to our sever we "lucked out" because the age charged us for the incorrect one which was $1 cheaper. I was still in shock it was on my bill! Paid, left, and won't be back!

M2MoLn1LmXnHr-YdEzi2ZA.text: My sister and I took our kids here for lunch. The server was really nice but the food wasn't very good. The portions are small and the price doesn't match the portions. They gave our kids 10 French fries each with their chicken tenders meal. I'm all for smaller portions but the prices are too high for such small portions. We will not go back.

nwTbbZuf5GIziU2MWdHz0w.text: Like a panera bread upgrade.  My wife and I have tried many different things from the menu and every one has delivered.

hvo-66xDs3q4qAOcogPuSg.text: I'm so disappointed.  I usually love this place, the Monte Cristo is my favorite and their white cheddar mac is usually so delicious.  I just picked up dinner for my husband and I, however,  and they forgot the sauce that makes the sandwich so good - it's advertised as crispy and it was soggy; I'm not going to eat it. They forgot his drink, the bread they used for his sandwich was stale and the macaroni and cheese tastes like they made it yesterday-ish.   I called and they told me they'd refund my credit card for the soda.   Thirty bucks down the drain.   I won't be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is NOT what it usually looks like.

oC8xROLgzJdHb_yrWJObBQ.text: They have great food and one of the best beer selections in the North Hills. Go on Wednesday night for their burger special ($6 for an awesome burger) and occasionally trivia. The prices are good, they also have great pizza. It's really a good place, just not a great location.  Also, if you like soup you'll love this place. Fresh, homemade soups daily.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The beer coolers, including two infusers.

ZRoKaqx8t5tvImlRsc0JxA.text: Chicken sandwich was good, buffalo chicken mac was also good. Large beer selection, friendly speedy service. The side salad was very fresh and very good, also there is home made ranch dressing which was amazing!

fdlYXuAXzazbwnmXR7DHoQ.text: I have eaten at Stoke's Grill many times over the past few years and they never disappoint. I have dined in & ordered out. They're sandwiches are perfect for ordering to go. Every time I've eaten @ Stoke's I've ordered the same thing just because I've never found any other place around town that offers pretzel sandwiches. I order the veggie sandwich (which comes with an assortment of veggies) with provolone & Russian dressing on a pretzel. It is so delicious! Also their fresh house made potato chips are so good!!  Stoke's Grill is a must try! And I highly recommend getting one of their sandwiches on a pretzel!

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ nachos. Yum!!
Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh made potato chips
Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie sandwich on a pretzel

ROJiohBXt0ZJ52-hGKT71Q.text: The food and beer selection are the stars here. We've had many appetizers, sandwiches and beers with friends. The buffalo chicken dip is very good. Their soups are always amazing. The strawberry/mango chilled soup & squash in the fall are the best. The club sandwich was very good. My friend liked the turkey pretzel sandwich. My husband likes the French dip. Most of the beers we had were delicious.  My only complaint is service related. Every time you come in there is no one to greet you. It takes 5 to 10 minutes to sit down. It would be better if they put the menus on the table & had people seat themselves. We had friend's birthday parties here & they were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chilled strawberry/mango soup - yum!

q6TLgvFnnRcFdRt5o2_C8A.text: I come here all the time. Great people. Wonderful food!! Perfect beer selection. I brought my soccer team here one night and this became the spot to be after every game. They accommodated even with no heads up and close to closing. Also quick service. Come and eat a quick meal or stay at long as you'd like. Fun place for individuals it big gross of people!!!

8uDhK742KF8zCESYseDE_A.text: Stoke's Grille is none to shabby.  I went in with low expectations and I was content and filled by my meal.  I had a salad. The components weren't original or unique but it had olives and balsamic vinaigrette  and I did gobble it up.  A dining companion had a BLT that was well prepared. Stoke's Grill serves your standard pub grub, dressed up cheese fries and there was buffalo chicken dip.  The service was attentive and well organized. I was dining with about 8 other people and the food came out hot, orderly and well prepared. There were murmurs of satisfaction around the table and the ladies I was with all seemed to be digging their meals.  Even though the meal was forgettable it wasn't disappointing. The four stars if for how well our large party was served.

gZTWpNop66x-G8W-p5g2Vg.text: Based on other reviews here, I was expecting something better than what we experienced here. Came in around 2pm on a Saturday. There was hardly anyone in the restaurant and it was very quiet and kind of had an overall awkward atmosphere - some TV ambient noise or a louder radio may be good here - we could hear everyone chewing and conversations around us - not pleasant.   I'm not sure if Stoke's has undergone new ownership or just gone downhill but for a non-busy afternoon on a Saturday our food was horrible and service was really slow (there were only 4 tables full in the whole place!). Freezer bag french fries that tasted like it...they were cold and soggy while some of them tasted like they maybe had been sitting around somewhere since the start of the day... None of our food was hot (or even tasted that good for that matter). I had the "Dank" pressed meatball/pesto sandwich - meatballs were again clearly from a bag and frozen and hubs had the "monte cristo"  - again awful - cold, soggy and just tasted like white bread. Super disappointing.   We also got a small order of wings - sauce was greasy at best, wings were burnt, dry and over fried, and the "pretzel bites" with "queso" - the cheese sauce here was probably most disturbing...it was gritty and grainy and tasted like a bad taco. Gross.   We sadly won't be back.

5LVdStvyWgeKQmPsiDVllw.text: I love Stoke's, it's always really good. I usually get the pretzel queso bites which are awesome! Today I got buffalo chicken macaroni and cheese and it was so rich and creamy. They have great homemade soups- the butternut squash is my favorite and the Nikko salad is refreshing and has a lot of flavor.

l983bdLIhWTAlnlwwONw9w.text: Call me a food snob and I've had more overcooked burgers than I care to remember...but not at Stokes! A perfect medium well, cooked through but still juicy with a crispy outer layer. The side of broccoli salad was excellent, the service with a smile and terrific draft list ....its a gem on RT19!

XqG-KCjpcwUFV-6a__t__Q.text: I would give this place five stars if the service were better.  It seems like the waitstaff disappears in the back for long periods of time.  I have sat with an empty glass for more than 10 minutes more than once.  Sometimes the servers will just walk by you without checking on you and you almost have to literally grab them.  That being said, the food is always very good.  I love the tomato pepper jack soup!  The burgers are good as is the chicken parm sandwich.  They have an excellent selection of beer on tap and a fairly large menu.  I really, really want them to do a better job with their waitstaff so I can bump this to five stars.  Until they get better, three is all I can do.  Update: it seems as though the waitstaff has gotten better or they hired more.  Wait times have dropped so I bumped up another star.  By the way, I love the tomato pepper jack soup and grilled cheese for lunch!

-VUnR_8Rb04fxcrhgh3BtA.text: Very impressed with Stoke's! I visited on a Wednesday night, it wasn't very busy and there was only one serving but surprisingly she busted it out and we had no issues waiting.   The food was delicious! I loved the buffalo chicken dip and crab bisque. Others at my table really enjoyed the buffalo mac and cheese.   The beer selection was impressive, something worthy of taking to trip here for.   With all of the bland chain restaurants along McKnight, this place was a wonderful break from the norm! Definitely will be back.

r7s1TPzNDfDqZz-LF3sCgg.text: Best happy hour in the North Hill.  Half-off all drafts from 4-6pm Monday through Friday.  Amy and Jason run a get place.  Get the Mac N' Cheese well done.  Chicken tenders are awesome too.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gnw3fbD1yr5DH4JzbHYAcQ.text: Average at best and not anything to go out of your way for. The food tasted good and our server was a sweetheart but the atmosphere is so boring, the dining area is a weird set up. Both times that I've been here the place was empty but the food still seemed to take forever to come out.

OTsydGybrvZgpqDLJJoSBA.text: I came here for lunch on a Thursday. Not exactly prime time for a restaurant on McKnight but there definitely should have been more than one server working. I waited over 5 minutes to be seated at one of the many empty tables and another 15 for the server to bring the water I had asked for. The food came out quickly and was pretty good. If not for the poor service, this would likely be a 4 or 5 star rating but it was a bad first impression.  Great beer selection and I would definitely come here for happy hour. Hopefully the service is better in the evenings.

PlOi4jgR_2pmZ5NofJgqnA.text: Seriously this place is a hidden gem.  If you like burgers go on a Wednesday night.  You cannot beat their homemade soups. The soup is so good for takeout too!

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

IC5cqo207cdpN98hnYrMag.text: Stoke's always has a nice beer selection on tap and plenty in the cooler to choose from.  You can either eat in the bar area or the dining room - we prefer the bar area.  The bartender is your server so if the bar is busy, sometimes they don't get to the tables as often as you might like but you can walk up and get their attention.    Their food has been consistent over the few times we've been there.  I really enjoyed the roast beef wrap which is nicely grilled and crispy on the outside. Their coleslaw and broccoli salad were both super good!  We also tried the green fries which come with artichokes, pesto, and brie cheese that were very good.    They get a nice mix of old/young patrons and the vibe is laid back.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Highlander Wrap w Roast Beef
Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green Fries w Pesto Artichokes &amp; Brie

YfDw1SgrR0MliXByJccxJA.text: I ate here five hours ago and I'm sick as hell. I ate the chips and the smallest Mac&Cheese white cheddar. I been sick every since.    I feel poisoned. I'm close to making a visit to the ER.   This place is not safe to eat in.

Mf4x6_6EoAXg7wW4ZoaRIA.text: This is nice restaurant. It is a casual attire. They have a nice menu with some great choices. They also have a very good draft selection. Most are local breweries. They also have a large selection of can and bottled beers. The staff is very nice. I highly recommend trying it.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reuben sandwich

cVdDJOELaaw8Dj_E6evvhQ.text: Overall I would say Stoke's is a very average establishment.  The place could definitely be better with some very easy and minor changes.  The best part of my last experience was our server, Austin.  She was very friendly, helpful, and hard working.  To start, the atmosphere of the place is very boring and plain.  The inside had no personality and just seems like a firehall with some tables and a bar thrown into it.  The TVs are too small to see.  The music is so low that you can hear a pin drop.  The presentation of all of the food is also very poor.  Cheap plastic containers and things just thrown onto a plate.  I get that it is a sports bar, but the best sports bars put in the extra effort on small things which make a big difference.  The food is pretty decent.  I had the French dip sandwich last time and it had a good flavor.  The buffalo chicken dip is also pretty good here, but for some reason they give you potatoes chips instead of tortilla chips.  Makes no sense.  I have also had their wings, salads, and pretzel sandwiches.  All of those were simply average.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French dip with buffalo chicken Mac and cheese

gSHaljha8q00h5pDBDX-2w.text: This is underappreciated gem in the North Hills.  It has a super interesting and diverse menu of sandwiches, homemade soups, Mac n' cheese, and salads that are always delicious. Usually when I find a place I love, I order the same thing most of the time. But at Stoke's I keep trying different items and I'm never disappointed. It also has a great draft list and separate eating space for families and folks at the bar. Excellent prompt service, and a place that everytime I go back to, I think we should come here more.  While not a pizza place per se, after 5 years of independent testing my husband and I think it's the best pizza in Pittsburgh.

tgAOmxM_7dV_NyEZYLtfkQ.text: My husband and I's experience here was a little off. We came here on a Friday night around 7pm. Considering Stoke's is a bar serving many different types of craft beers with a large food menu, we figured it would be bumping. It was anything but. It was seriously so quiet and so awkward. The bar and restaurant were full! It was the establishment itself. We actually asked each other if we wanted to just get up and leave. We sat in the bar area and there was no music or TVs with sound on. So if you were looking for a lively Friday night spot, stay far away!  As far as food is concerned, it was decent. We started with buffalo chicken dip. The dip itself was amazing! However, it is served with house made potato chips. With buffalo chicken dip I prefer tortilla type chips, the housemade chips were good but not mixed with the dip. An option for either would be cool! My husband enjoyed his beef dip and Mac n cheese. The Mac n cheese was SO GOOD!! I had a "Stoke's favorite" pretzel sandwich. It was ok. The pretzel was fried and I am not a fan of fried greasiness. The pretzel was also very thin so I mostly just ate turkey. I will say the menu is very large and they serve half portions of some menu items which I think is an awesome idea for restaurants.   I'd give 2 stars but bonus star for our server! Austin was awesome and so nice! She gave suggestions and was super personable.

F7cWzge69LAM3B1Xu6WKCw.text: Great selection of local craft beers, including mindful brewing and hitchhiker.  Got myself a mindful draft, a bit pricy but for a high gravity ale it was worth it.    Ordered a pit dip sandwich, roast beef French dip.  It was recommended and beat expectations.  This place is typical pub food done well, at least my sandwich was.    Bartender was good and attentive.   Would recommend if you want a greasy sandwich and a good beer.

VVeytIUaiB3cM58EbzWXOg.text: Good bar food. I love their butternut squash soup! Their pretzel sandwiches are also pretty tasty. They have good happy hour and daily specials. Great for groups!

BwofyJ9BL9vC-n2mnruqrw.text: Was meeting a friend here and initially walked into the bar area and it was so quiet. There were TVs in the bar area, but no sound coming from them. That was my initial impression. I ordered a fish sandwich with fries and i am used to ordering fish and it being this huge sandwich. This was more on the smaller end. I don't think that is a bad or good thing, just pointing it out in case you are used to those fish sandwiches that are falling out of the bun on the ends. The sandwich was good, I wouldn't say it was anything to rave about. The waitstaff/bartenders were friendly and the drinks reasonably priced. I would come back if i was meeting someone again, but its not going to be added to my frequent flyers list of places to eat.

1KDnNTzEuTfB71jauhYMdA.text: We had a great time here. Three of us came during the afternoon and there was no wait time. They had amazing drinks, food and service. I ordered the quesadillas which were great. Our waitress was quick and did a fantastic job. I would definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quesadillas

97ufsfGpxSxl6jDo1xC2qw.text: We were meeting friends in the area so we had to find a place to watch some games. The restaurant was pretty empty when we got there. All the beers were on the way so that was cool but it was kind of hard to see.  The menu had lots of options . We had a wide range of people eating so lots meals. We had a pizza, BLT, Wings, and soup. Everyone was able to share everything and no one was unhappy. The sandwich came with soup and it was not exactly enough food by itself but with the wings, it was good.  There are lots of tvs so you won't miss the game if you come here.

jjubb3j_XC4Xt2exvKlH8w.text: The bartender was really nice when we walked in. Yes she was busy but let us know that she would be with us very soon. And she was True to her promise. The food was amazing.  I tried the seasonal Butternut squash soup I must declare this was heavenly!  My hubby got a steak hoagie sorry forget the name. Amazing!  He also got a side of the buffalo Mac n Cheese. We r so in shock delicious. And I got the bacon cheeseburger. I again have no words!  You MUST come here!!!!  When the bartender was struggling the staff in back came out to help her no questions asked!  Good people here!!!

r04vjiAk1lNkkJKFKE4hhA.text: This place has  the most boring atmosphere I have ever seen. A middle school cafeteria has more personality.  Our waitress was not familiar with the menu at all, she could not answer any questions about food or drinks, she just kept answering I'm not really sure or I really don't eat that. This is complete incompetence on the owner and managers part hiring people like this. The menu is a very hard read at best. Way to much packed onto the dark hard to disifer menu. Chili was served stone cold and chicken wings were sub par. I was made to feel like an idiot because I wanted a domestic bottled beer as opposed to some pretentious micro brew or IPA No thank you Stokes. I will not be going back.

fkWYjFVsZ9qL_LMP-IQZyg.text: I am simply amazed as to how many restaurants there are along McKnight Road.  I wasn't familiar with this place so we decided to see what it was all about.  It's located in one of the older plazas along McKnight and it is almost hard to spot unless you are really looking for it. It is located in the same plaza as Lasik Vision.  The place is very spacious, almost too spacious because the layout seems to be off balance or something.  Large wide open dining room on one side and a separate bar with some tables throughout in the other room.  Our waitress was in training so we had two servers.  They were a cute team.  Between the two of them we were thanked at least 25 times during our meal.  Speaking of the meal, I did something I normally don't do -  I ordered a sandwich that I absolutely had no real desire to try but I just had to order it to see how it would turn out.  I ordered the Monte Cristo.  The menu describes it as such: Ham, turkey and provolone.  Battered and deep fried crispy and served with a side of roasted red pepper aioli.  It looked liked fried chicken when it was served but I must say it tasted better than I thought it would but it was way too heavy to finish it  myself.  It would be something fun to order and share with a few people.  The aioli gave it a nice zing.  The menu overall offers grilled sandwiches, pressed sandwiches, wraps, hoagies, burgers, pretzel sandwiches, salads, 3 kinds of mac n cheese, homemade chips, homemade soups made from scratch, regular and specialty pizzas.   My friend ordered the Stokes pick two which is a side salad or cup of soup with a half sandwich for $ 8.00.  I look forward to another visit to Stoke's Grill.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Read the bottom of their menu.
Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Monte Cristo

Xpyv2FQbW5HRH48EeQ1X3Q.text: Love this place! Chill ambience and a great menu. My friends and I loved the buffalo chicken dip and the chili queso. The pretzel bites that came with the queso were amazing, better than anywhere I've been before! My one issue with this place was when I ordered a margarita and our server let me know it would be pretty tart because they didn't have a margarita mix, just lemon juice I think? Not that it's the biggest deal in the world, but if you guys have a full bar, I think that should be something readily available. Other than that, service was great and we loved the food. Will definitely be back!

QXa6oSewPhDDU4zbREFFcg.text: We really liked our food at Stoke's. They had a pretty big list of soups that sounded delicious, and wide selection of beers.   The Monte Cristo Sandwich (ham, turkey, and provolone sandwich) was quartered, battered, and fried. The roasted red pepper aioli (red pepper mayo) made for a nice dipping sauce. The broccoli salad was a very nice surprise. The broccoli was fresh and raw, the red onion was not overtly oniony, and the dressing was slightly sweet and just enough so you could still taste the other ingredients.  On another Yelper's tip, I tried the Ropa Vieja. It's a pressed sandwich featuring slightly spicy shredded pork (carnitas pork) and roasted red peppers with a side of au jus. I selected the onion rings for my side, which were definitely a hit with the batter staying on the onion and not sliding off.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Monte cristo
Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ropa vieja

9dwDqpGxf37aLhxNV4wq0g.text: The first time I tried to come here I stood by the host stand waiting to be seated for about ten minutes, I ended up leaving. They weren't too busy and there were definitely servers around! I'm not sure what happened.   I decided to give the restaurant another chance and I'm glad that I did! They have a great beer selection (Troegs Mad Elf!!!) and their menu is great, so many options. I got buffalo chicken dip with chips and a pulled pork sandwich with fries. I wasn't too thrilled about the fries, but I think that was more of a personal preference. My server was a sweetheart as well. She was on top of everything, but she wasn't overbearing!  I would definitely come back and I would recommend this restaurant!

ZK0St_d8eckyXdDZ7em_pA.text: What is the point of being in business if you do not remain open during posted business hours? My wife and I drove here and arrived at 1115pm last night but it was closed. Both the website and front door say open until 1200, midnight. This is unacceptable.   The restaurant itself has really good sandwich and pizza options with a great selection of beer. Had they been open the review based on the food and drink would have most likely been 4 or 5 stars. I'm curious to know why they were closed, as I assume they are still in business. Might go back, especially if I know why (want to make sure they still open when I want to go next), and would consider rewriting the review.

GkLfJFHirJ7bMeXCBVU5Mw.text: This review is only for the food as we got take out.  Overall, I'd say they had some unique options on their menu, especially for sandwiches.  I got the Widowmaker, which sounded better than it tasted.  It wasn't gross or anything, I just expected something better.  I might give it another try in the future as they did have different options on the menu that you can't get at other places in the area.  It's one of those places where if a friend said let's go here, I wouldn't object, but it's also not going to be a regular place I eat at either.

Ehh4iTmpQLc6ftdP4p0MyQ.text: I lived near Stoke's when it first opened years ago. I recently made my way back. Wow. The beer list is great for you beer snobs. I don't know how to describe the menu. It has a mix of wraps, soups, sandwiches, and salads. But that description doesn't do the food justice. It is really great quality. I tend to go to the ropa vieja panini. A little spicy, but it reminds me of the Cuban food were missing in Pittsburgh. The French Onion soup is really flavorful. Just a solid place. They have a thoughtful and creative menu. Things will look familiar by name, but they've done a great job making everything better than the usual.

cEtEebqXpKkjk7NsVvx_tA.text: Every time I visit Pittsburgh, I visit Stoke's several times! Yes, I do eat at other places as well, sometimes, but this place is exceptional. The food is ultra high quality, and also on the more creative side. The prices are excellent and the staff are genuinely warm and friendly. This place can get ridiculously busy, especially at lunch, so you may have to wait a while for your order, or even to get seated sometimes, but there is a VERY good reason why so many people choose to eat here. Aside from the food, the selection of beers is exceptionally diverse. Most of the beer is craft beer, or smaller breweries. This is not the kind of place where Budweiser would ever feel welcome, or Coors. Anyway, this place is exceptional. Don't forget to also try their pizza. While Stoke's is not a pizzeria, they easily could be one, because the pizza is among the best I have ever had. Again, some very exotic options for pizza. If you do not at least try this place once, you are a fool. I cannot be more clear.

1_6sJxP4SVCDlTgL6iCbRQ.text: I came here with a group from my conference because it was near their hotel.  Their green fries sounded appetizing, (fries, pesto sauce and brie) so we decided to share them around the table.  The counter lady asked if I wanted the fries out first and I said yes. Apparently that means "Please bring them out jut two seconds before the rest of the food for the table."  The first order had a hair in them.  They were gracious and replaced them, bringing them to use when we were about 75% through our meal.  At that point we really didn't want them, but there didn't offer to refund me and I didn't really ask.  they were bland, the pesto was only on the top 10 fries and the brie was invisible I guess. My chicken fingers were pretty run of the mill, the honey mustard was good however.  My friend ordered a pretzel sandwich and said it was really good and another girl ordered the lobster bisque.  She said that the soup had no flavor what so ever.

tOYajGJ2PxvxrJ1cN_li9A.text: This is a great place to go for take-out! My family & I stopped here for a quick meal on a Friday nite. We got one of the specials - Pepper Burgers & delicious homemade potato chips! The burgers were big half-pound Angus burgers with jalepenos, banana peppers, and cheddar cheese. I wasn't sure I would like this combo, but it was so delicious! I grabbed a menu, and Stoke's Grill also makes pretzel sandwiches, quesadillas, salads, soups, wrapitos, and classic deli sandwiches, too! There are so many choices, I'm not sure what I'll try next, but I'm sure it will be tasty! :)

XoATtmbJSRtaKj782QpOoQ.text: I grabbed a few sandwiches here and was very pleasantly surprised. The place is clean and fun, staff very friendly, and the menu offers good variety. Best of all, the food was really good and reasonably priced. They're also BYOB, which is always a plus.

I7f3BeKsF62aDWeOJcizYw.text: There are a bunch of places to eat on McKnight road, Stokes Grill is one of the best of the bunch. Fantastic homemade soups everyday, and their menu is pretty big. Great Sandwiches, and great food! Everything is fresh and can't be topped by anything within miles of its location. Don't miss it.

akylkiVLIRpG1rn65IOJLg.text: Stoke's is fairly stupdendous, given its slightly humble location (on McKnight Road, but in a little retail strip that's boring at best). Their menu is extensive - soups, sandwiches on any carbohydrate-based lifeform imaginable, salads, burgers, and sides. That could sound potentially dull, but Stoke's hallmark is taking standard deli-grill offerings and either adding a gourmet ingredient or two (pesto, artichokes, and Brie on the fries!) or replacing crap-from-a-can with their own homemade or homecooked ingredients (roasted beef, fresh cheese sauce). The food, at worst, is satisfying and tasty, and at best is "omigod why don't I eat here every day." Usually the latter. The soups are ungodly good - atypical offerings like a chilled banana rum are great in summertime, and their cream of mushroom actually tastes of real mushrooms, instead of a gloppy milky mixture. As far as service goes, you couldn't ask for a friendlier fare. The owners (a young couple) offer genuine smiles every time, and are quick to accommodate their customers. It's clean, it's bright, there's plenty of beverage options (BYOB, as well). Prices are very reasonable (around $7 for most sandwich-type things) especially considering the portions are swell, and they often come with homemade chips!

pE6MzLX33nmzb0avJ2L3PQ.text: Embarrassing that imitation crabmeat is used in their soups. Seriously? And anything that expensive should atleast be of good quality. I wouldn't have mind paying for an higher rate as long as the meat in my food was not constructed in a lab. Utterly disappointed and very expensive for poor quality food.   Their burger was not too bad though.

DnhQsxPrYD6sn2jAC3CSEA.text: We love Stokes Grill! I've been a huge fan since they first opened and love that they now have a bar and party room. The owners have always been very kind and friendly and the staff follow their leadership. We never feel rushed when we eat in and enjoy the freshness of the food. I often hold small lunch meetings for work and Stokes has always been my go to place to order - everyone always leaves the meeting happy and asking where the food came from.

5KnXKaYdZNZ91U16MYm4Jw.text: I have gone to Stoke's Grill over the years and always had a decent experience. After tonight I will not be going back. When I first walked in, I stood at the hostess stand for at least 5 minutes, and did not once see an employee enter the dining room, and there were other tables there. When I finally was greeted it was an awkward "so like,?did you order take out, or.....?" To which I said I'd like a table(duh). I was sat at a dirty table, and than sat for another 5 minutes at least, while I was not acknowledged by anyone. Just as I was about to get up, a server came over, and another awkward greeting and drink order. After waiting another few minutes I moved into the bar. The service was slightly better in there, but still terrible. Waited with closed menus for a good 20 minutes or so. Once our order was in, the food came in a reasonable amount of time, and was mediocre. I will say they have a decent Reuben, but if you order the fries, they suck. Sorry, can't sugar coat that. For a place that makes their own food, getting a side of crappy frozen french fries is disappointing. Once our food came we waited again to get condiments, and again for our check. As a SIN veteran, and a former local, small business owner, I am surprised that they have made it this far with such a lackluster experience, considering the recent boom in awesome local eateries, where the service typically matches the incredible food. It's one thing when a restaurant/bar is busy; I have no problem waiting however long it takes, as long as I see that the service is making a valiant effort, but this experience was clearly just lazy people giving zero f***s.

DgPTryI56x9WZgn6NI-7kw.text: Amazing crab bisque and grilled cheese. Their pizza is also quite good and the staff is always friendly. This is one of our go-to places.

q7JKVKkck1h2tvU21R33Uw.text: This is the best Pittsburgh deli-style restaurant I've found yet!  Forget the fact that the atmosphere is what I like to call "strip mall chic"; It's all about the food here!  Whether it be their delicious "green fries" with pesto, brie, and artichokes, fabulous homemade soup selections (about 7 daily), or the yummiest pretzel sandwiches I've ever tasted... this restaurant is where I go for a WOW lunch!  Plusses for not having to leave much of a tip (you order up front) and the all-you-can-drink fill it yourself fountain sodas.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke's Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MCJOpfOJVTr1F_C6359UvA.text: This place is great!  Ordered up a Pittsburgh Dip and the Yellow fries and my son had the Rangamala and White fries. The Pittsburgh Dip is like a French dip sandwich but with fried onion twists, French fries and cheese melted on and comes with an au jus. The Yellow fries have cheddar and bacon served with a side of ranch. The Rangamala is a half pound burger with cheddar cheese and bacon (and super juicy!).  The White fries have garlic aioli and parmesan sauce on them. The sandwiches were served with homemade potato chips and a pickle. All were very good!  Portions are just right.  They aren't skimpy nor overwhelming. I noticed some comments about the cost.  My bill did come to $33 but the food is fresh.  The hamburger is hormone and antibiotic free. I don't mind paying a little extra for quality food. They are expanding the restaurant and is currently under renovation, but they are open and it is super clean.  The other side they are putting in a bar.   The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Service was prompt. Yes, they are now full service! There isn't a thing I could find negative about the place.  We will definitely be back to try more items on the menu!

VktWg1GWCH_zcSMU3V7DhA.text: Excellent food and service.  The beer selection is great and all menu options are fresh and home made with creativity. Highly recommended.

RPW_WQTnI1lgCQFnY7Vm8w.text: I went to Stoke's Grill while visiting the Target on Mcknight Road for a quick dinner. I imagined it to be a full sit-down restaurant for some reason so I was a little surprised when it turned out to be more of a smaller casual type of place. You order your food at the counter and they bring it out to you.  I got the Italian Beef sandwich which was Italian seasoned beef with hot peppers and provolone on a hoagie roll. To go with it I ordered some onion rings as well. My girlfriend got the tomato pepper jack soup, a meatball sandwich and a side of their homemade potato chips. The Italian beef wasn't like what you'd get in Chicago and would probably be pure blasphemy over there but I liked it. It was a simple sandwich but the ingredients went well together. My only gripe was I wished the beef was cut thinner and had some juice with it. It wasn't dry but when I think of Italian beef I think of heavily seasoned, thin meat that is swimming in its own au jus.  The onion rings were really good. The batter they used was the cripsy kind rather than that soggy grainy kind you sometimes see. They epitomized the texture and flavor of a good onion ring. They were browned with a good crunch to them and the onion in the middle was cooked thoroughly and didn't slide out like a worm (this almost makes me gag when it happens with badly prepared rings, it's such a terrible mental image).  Janey thought the meatball sandwich was just average. She likes her meatballs seasoned and she said they didn't have a lot of flavor, just ground beef. She liked it but she wasn't blown away by it. The chips were really good, though. Whoever fries in the kitchen knows what they're doing.  The soup was creamy and spicy and really good. It was more peppery than tomato which is why I liked it. I'm not a tomato person so tomato soup has never been one of my favorites. Janey really enjoyed the soup and even though she's not much of a sandwich eater thought we should come back again and try more of the menu.  The interior of Stoke's is very nice and is clean. The guy at the counter was really nice and friendly as well.

oFFF2BxIMe-PJ7aHrk1t3A.text: The food is great, the environment is A+, but the service is total crap. I'm taking off one star for that. I previously wrote a long 1 star review, but their damn food is tasty, so I'm giving three back for that.

h05axiGfQY0UMnAUDRCTGw.text: I've been anxious to try Stoke's for a while now, and when a Living Social deal popped up, I jumped on it.    My husband and I were both home one week day and needed some quick lunch to-go.  Despite looking from the outside like a sit down bar and grill type joint, I had heard that Stokes was more of a grab and go sort of place.    I was impressed by the menu, so many things sounded good.  I decided on a half a sandwich and soup combo, the grilled cheese and the pepperjack tomato soup.  My husband got the BLT and the chili.    My grilled cheese was on soft, delicious bread.  The cheeses were melted until oozy - just the way I like it.  The pepperjack was a nice variation on traditional tomato soup, giving it a spicy kick and bold flavor.    My husband's BLT had a lot of crispy bacon, which he enjoyed, although he said the chili was "just OK" (I'll pretend that's because chili I make is out of this world).  Stoke's made us a very satisfying lunch, definitely a step up from other quick places in the area.  Two reasons why I did not give it 5 stars, though...  1.  The marketing of Stoke's is just all wrong.  The exterior really makes you think it's something that it is not.  Also, their menu, although impressive, is designed so that it is very hard to read.  I'd like to think this place would be way more popular if they fixed these few small details!  2.  The pricing is a little steep for what you get.  Our lunches were over $20 total, which I thought was more than what I would pay elsewhere.  Still, I'd compare it to a local Panera Bread, with better ingredients, flavors, and choices.

NbHhPkh6fKBY2LFleWZ-Mg.text: I love this place and the soup.  I always get the crab bisque and I love the pretzel sandwiches.  They have lots of options for food and sandwiches (the hitch, monkey fist, etc) and its a good yet fairly unknown place.

Om7oc_xF9b3N3vfZJxhIKQ.text: Surprisingly good, on the expensive side but still really tasty. The mac & cheese was SO rich and I was really shocked that the chicken on my chicken philly was REAL chicken! The food comes out scalding hot, so be careful. The staff is super polite too. You should give this place a try!

oL19L3cBqZW4AGA0uRWBmA.text: I posted on Facebook suggestions for lunch in the North Hills and someone recommended this place to me.  It looked like it had easy enough access for me, so I decided to check it out.  I was craving a healthy-but-salty (oxymoron, right?) salad but changed my mind when I checked out the menu.  It's an average sized place with a counter that you walk up to and order from.  You pay, sit, and they bring your food to you.  It is BYO which is nice but not traditional as the place doesn't really seem to "fit" a BYO restaurant in the vibe or menu (it's a deli essentially).  I ordered the white cheddar mac and cheese because it had an entire section on the menu for it so I figured it would be good.  I also ordered the Motmot wrap which had turkey, bacon, some tomato aioli.   I also got a foundtain drink.  It ended up at about $15 which seemed a little high for a lunch.  The service was quick which is nice for a workday lunch.    The (side order) of mac and cheese?  It was really good and could be a meal in itself.  The bowl was put under a broiler to make it a little crispy.  The noodles were slightly overcooked which I do not prefer in  mac and cheese but the star of the dish was, of course, the cheese.  Thick cheese sauce that I knew was hearty after three bites.  Very cheddary--not too sharp.  It was more like a glue than a sauce.  The wrap came with chips and was served warm which I was not expecting.  Too much aioli--this is common at restaurants anywhere, but I don't think a sandwhich needs to be dripping in dressing, especially since this was nothing special.  The turkey was nice and thinly sliced.  The bacon felt more like bacon bits than chopped bacon or even slices of bacon.  The turkey was fresh.  I only had a few chips.  I couldn't tell if they were house made or otherwise.    I went back after my three bites of mac and cheese for more.  Outside of the noodles being overcooked, that dish is really something special.    I would go back to try something else, just not a wrap because I think for the cost it's lacking in execution and flavor.

kJdPt12RoOz1H0MQbalk7A.text: Great beer selection during Pittsburgh beer week. Food was good and the onion rings exceptional!  Good environment to talk which was a good thing as the service was shockingly slow.  We will be back.

zpDSwTaI5bDTBhFTOIWnaA.text: We've been going to Stoke's since they opened.  The food is always good but overpriced for what you get.  We always say we are not going to go back but end up going back because they have great sandwiches.  Last night, I ordered a veggie sandwich.  I thought it was odd that it didn't come with cheese since there wasn't much to the sandwich.  I asked for provolone cheese.  When we got the bill, I found we were charged $1.50 for one slice of cheese which is ridiculous.  After we ordered, I wanted to change my side dish choice so I asked the waitress if it was too late to make the change.  She said it was because the kitchen gets really mad when you make a change.  There was no sense complaining about it because the owner acts if he is doing you a favor by being at his restaurant.  He definitely needs to improve his customer service skills.

afncXeuAi__uSAU8mVI0-Q.text: Have been going here for years.  The good is very good.  The homemade soups are excellent!   Unique soup picks based on season along with all-time favorites like Crab Bisque.  Love the Frizzle quesadilla, Cuban sandwich, Pretzel sandwiches.  I don't think that I have had a bad meal there.  They recently increased the size of the restaurant and added a great bar.  The bar has very unique choices of beer that you can't find in most other places.  The owners are always there and are very nice people.  The staff are always outgoing and care about their customers.   This is one of those reliable places to eat to where you know you won't be disappointed and will leave feeling good.

38ZSdQ1eKane51Y4bwCPFA.text: Stokes Grill hands down has the best sandwiches in Pittsburgh, particularly the Larkshead, which is a pretzel sandwich and out of this world amazing! Their chips I believe are house made and also delicious but I highly recommend giving a cup of one of their fabulous soups a try! Their cream of mushroom soup is totally irresistible. They've recently upgraded and added a bar; while they specialize in serving craft beer there are other options too. Personally, I'm more of a wine person and, while they currently have a small selection, there's enough to keep me coming back!

84_-cVxPtAuaCXzkbdHBkw.text: We have been eating here since they opened and have become part of their family. The soups are sooooooooooooo goooooooooooooooood. The sandwiches and burgers are really great, as well. We enjoyed their breakfasts when they had them. This is our first choice when we want to eat out. The Faschnacht Day potato donuts were awesome. I miss the ribs that they had as an appetizer.

Nf77rvLy1RvB6dsg0P9OBQ.text: perfect for takeout or sit down, nice bar, True love in every bite.  real onion rings, and real ingredients make the difference.

--096Ajil4RQtvH4silZng.text: I ordered White Fries and it had a hair in it! Didnt eat any of them. I also got a Philly chicken and the meat was very dry and the hoagie roll was way over toasted. Not impressed.
